question.title: How can I identify the most common sequences of method calls in Java project?
question.body:
How can I identify the most common sequences of method calls in my Java project? While I know how to find usages of a single method in IntelliJ or Eclipse, I'm looking for a straightforward way to determine which sequences of methods are frequently used together.

For example, given I have the below java class:

public class Helpers {

    public static void method0(){}
    public static void method1(){}
    public static void method2(){}
    public static void method3(){}
}

and then this methods are used in a test class as below:

public class AppTest extends TestCase {

    private final Helpers helpers = new Helpers();
    public void AppTest( String testName )
    {
        helpers.method0();
        helpers.method1();
    }

    public void AppTest1(String testName )
    {
        helpers.method0();
        helpers.method2();
    }

    public void AppTest2(String testName )
    {
        helpers.method0();
        helpers.method1();
    }
}

So, the most common pattern of usage in this should be:

Sequence length 1: method0();
Sequence length 2: method0(); method1();

What I have tried: I noticed there is a library in python called javalang which is able to parse java code and i can develop my own snippet to analyze java projects,however i guess there should be an easier way or existing tools which does this !
